summary: The U.S. government plans to spend approximately $35 billion on foreign assistance in 2017 to improve the lives and health of millions living in poverty, support democracy, and enhance global security. We found that the six federal agencies that spent the most on foreign assistance from 2011 through 2015—DOD, HHS, the Millennium Challenge Corporation, the State Department, USAID, and USDA—developed more than 60 strategy documents...
title: U.S. Foreign Assistance: Inventory of Strategies at Selected Agencies
